comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Baron Alexander Vasilyevich Kaulbars (Russian: Александр Васильевич Каульбарс ) (May 14, 1844 - January 25, 1925) was a general in the Imperial Russian Navy. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_Kaulbars

comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: All of the decorations and gold braid make me smile.  I wonder if they were meant to intimidate the enemy?

comment.author: 45179809@N00
comment._content: decorations don't scare the enemy.  Those decorations are to intimidate his own staff into submission to his command, ie- subordinate anyone on his own side, make sure they're following his plan and not going off on their own plans.  Actually, so much decoration indicates desperation, a mask compensating for weekness, as it didn't work, as even his own staff went against him, having their Communist Revolution in 1917.

comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: well perhaps the staff was the enemy!  LOL

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
trialsanderrors:

Thanks for the further information on Gen. Kaulbars. (I think you made a switch of two words in your comment, as he was a general in the Imperial Russian Army, rather than the Navy. ) We will expand the description when we update this record to reflect these new details.

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Sorry for that, obvsly general = army, admiral = navy.
